column2: # Provide summary insights and recommendations based on model performance
"- All three models demonstrated strong forecasting performance for short-term fuel prices.\n",
"- Based on RMSE, MAE, and MAPE, SARIMAX (Internal) — which incorporates Quantity Per Transaction — delivered the most accurate predictions.\n",
"- This suggests that internal consumer behaviour may provide more predictive value than external Brent price signals in the current context.\n",
"- Adopt SARIMAX (Internal) for short-term weekly forecasting of fuel prices.\n",
"- Continue monitoring Brent price relationships, but prioritise internal behavioural metrics where timely data is available.\n",
"- Consider building hybrid models or regime-switching frameworks in future studies to dynamically adapt to shifting market drivers.\n")
- All three models demonstrated strong forecasting performance for short-term fuel prices.
- Based on RMSE, MAE, and MAPE, SARIMAX (Internal) — which incorporates Quantity Per Transaction — delivered the most accurate predictions.
- This suggests that internal consumer behaviour may provide more predictive value than external Brent price signals in the current context.
- Adopt SARIMAX (Internal) for short-term weekly forecasting of fuel prices.
- Continue monitoring Brent price relationships, but prioritise internal behavioural metrics where timely data is available.
- Consider building hybrid models or regime-switching frameworks in future studies to dynamically adapt to shifting market drivers.
